statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Jacksonville St. 87, VMI 85
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. (AP) -- Dorien Brown scored the deciding basket and Courtney Bradley had 30 points and 17 rebounds to lead Jacksonville State past VMI 87-85 in the third place game of the William & Mary Tip-Off Classic on Saturday. Brown led the Gamecocks (2-4) in the final minutes as the team came from six down with 2:50 to play to win in a game that saw the lead change hands seven times. Brown hit one of his two free throws and then Bradley made a lay-up to pull Jacksonville State to within three with 1:32 left. At the 50 second mark, Brown scored on a jumper that cut VMI's lead to 85-84. With 18 seconds to play, Brown grabbed a rebound off of a missed Will Ginn shot and put it back for a score to put Jacksonville State ahead 86-85. Bradley made a free throw with five seconds remaining to finalize the score. The Gamecocks had an 11-point lead with 3:09 left in the first half, but saw that evaporate as the Keydets (3-7) went on a 12-4 run to close the half. VMI led 58-55 at halftime, but the Keydets' accuracy fell off in the second. VMI's high-intensity offense made 44.4 percent from the field in the first, but only 25 percent in the second. The Keydets also made just 12 of their 37 3-point attempts throughout the game. Jacksonville State attempted 22 fewer 3-pointers and 18 fewer field goals than VMI. But the Gamecocks made their shots count, going 50.8 percent from the field and 40 percent from 3-point range. Erik Adams scored 16 points and Ginn had 15 for the Gamecocks. Reggie Williams led the Keydets with 22 points, Chavis Holmes had 18 and Travis Holmes had 16.
